description: Some metal recycling companies stand to benefit from Trump’s steel and aluminum duties, but they fear any boost could be blunted by foreign countermeasures.
title: As retaliatory tariffs mount, recyclers worry what goes around, comes around

description: Three South Carolina men and a juvenile were charged with a misdemeanor Tuesday after authorities said their failure to properly put out their cigarettes sparked the Table Rock Fire that has burned more than 13,000 acres.
title: Cigarettes caused South Carolina's Table Rock Fire, forestry commission says

description: The Trump administration on Tuesday eliminated the entire staff of a federal program that helps low-income households pay utility bills, sources said.
title: Entire staff responsible for utility assistance included in HHS cuts, sources say

description: Los Angeles prosecutors declined to file formal charges against former "NYPD Blue" actor Kim Delaney and her husband after they were accused of domestic violence.
title: 'NYPD Blue' actor Kim Delaney and her husband won't be charged after arrest

description: Eying a vote on a multitrillion-dollar budget blueprint this week, Senate Republicans are considering a far-reaching move to that would set a $0 cost for making President Donald Trump’s tax cuts permanent.
title: Senate Republicans eye budget vote amid growing fight over Trump tax cuts

description: Government records obtained by the ACLU show a point system used by immigration authorities that families and attorneys say unfairly targeted Venezuelan deportees.
title: Immigration scorecard for deportations relied on tattoos and social posts, court filings show

description: Mahmoud Khalil, who was studying at Columbia, and Alireza Doroudi, from the University of Alabama, are both being held at an ICE processing center in Jena, Louisiana.
title: Detained students sent to remote ICE facilities in Louisiana accused of human rights abuses

description: Coastal Carolina University threw a lot of ideas at the wall before landing on a tasty way to drum up more football ticket sales — free food at the concession stand. Fans attending football games at Brooks Stadium next season will be able to order as many hot dogs, nachos, popcorn and soda as their stomachs will allow.
title: College in S.C. will offer free nachos and hot dogs to draw more football fans to games

description: During the 2025 season the NFL will determine whether teams have reached a first down by using Sony’s Hawk-Eye system of six, 8K cameras that will optically track the position of the ball.
title: NFL to use cameras, not chains, to determine first downs in 2025

description: U.S. Bank vice chair Terry Dolan was the only person on board a single-engine airplane that crashed and exploded over the weekend, a Minnesota medical examiner confirmed Tuesday.
title: Minnesota authorities identify plane crash victim as U.S. Bank executive

description: NEILY, Costa Rica — After being deported from the U.S. with his wife and 6-year-old son, German Smirnov, a Russian national, is being held at a migrant camp in the Central American country.
title: After a month in a Costa Rican shelter, many deported from the U.S. still have no home

description: As Texas measles outbreak continues, federal funding cuts have forced public health officials in Dallas to cancel dozens of vaccination clinics and lay off 21 workers.
title: Dozens of free measles vaccine clinics close in Texas as federal funding is cut

description: WASHINGTON — The White House's firing of a career federal prosecutor last week was one in a series of Trump administration moves that have undermined the post-Watergate separation between the White House and the Justice Department — and spread fears about political interference in ongoing criminal cases.
title: White House firing of a career prosecutor pulls DOJ under ever-closer control

description: President Donald Trump will meet with Vice President JD Vance and other advisers Wednesday to discuss a deal for TikTok as a deadline nears.
title: Trump to hold a White House meeting on TikTok as deadline nears

description: Steve Kornacki breaks down two key areas to watch in Wisconsin ahead of the state Supreme Court election.
title: What to watch for in Wisconsin tonight: From the Politics Desk

description: NBC News Senior Homeland Security Correspondent Julia Ainsley explains how a man who is in the U.S. legally was deported to El Salvador. In court filings, the Trump administration says it was an "administrative error.”
title: Trump administration admits 'administrative error' in deporting Maryland man to El Salvador

description: When the walls of a vacant public building in Salt Lake City became a canvas to commemorate victims of police violence, the 8.5-acre area of town known as Fleet Block gave a “sense of cultural inclusion” to the city, which is predominantly white.
title: In Salt Lake City, murals memorializing George Floyd, Breonna Taylor and others come tumbling down

description: General Motors and other automakers reported notable increases in their first-quarter U.S. vehicle sales, as the automotive industry braces for the impacts of President Donald Trump’s auto tariffs that are set to take effect this week.
title: GM's first-quarter U.S. vehicle sales lead industry as automakers brace for tariffs

description: The S&P 500 climbed on Tuesday in another volatile session as the market awaited clarity from President Donald Trump regarding his tariff policy rollout.
title: S&P 500 closes higher to start new quarter as traders await Trump's tariff rollout

description: NBC News is tracking confirmed measles case counts and state infection tallies, this data will be updated every Tuesday and Friday.
title: Map: Track the spread of measles in the U.S.

description: Paper checks were already dying a slow death.
title: The federal government is phasing out paper checks. Here's who will be affected.

description: Meta’s head of artificial intelligence research announced Tuesday that she will be leaving the company.
title: Meta's head of AI research announces departure

description: Wall Street is hoping April 2 will provide clarity on the U.S. tariff front and a reprieve from the recent market volatility.
title: Investors hope April 2 could bring some tariff clarity and relief. That may not happen

description: A former Alabama police officer who fired more than a dozen rounds in less than two seconds and killed a Black man during a truck repossession in 2023 will have to stand trial after a judge denied him immunity.
title: Ex-Alabama officer who fatally shot Black man during truck repossession is denied immunity

description: A Cornell University graduate student whose visa was revoked following his involvement in a lawsuit against the Trump administration over its actions against pro-Palestinian student protesters announced Monday that he will be leaving the U.S. voluntarily.
title: Cornell University student activist whose visa was revoked announces departure from the U.S.

description: The wife of the Maui doctor charged with attempted murder after she was attacked with a rock and nearly shoved off a cliff said her husband had sexually abused and assaulted her for months.
title: Wife alleges she was abused for months before Maui doctor tried to push her off cliff

description: Maria Shriver would like to set the record straight about the differences between her son and the character he plays on “The White Lotus.”

description: Olivia Munn has parenting “breakdowns,” just like the rest of us.

description: Jack Black is headed back to the jungle
title: Jack Black confirms he's returning for 'Jumanji 4' following speculation

description: It sounds like Bruce Willis had to try hard to get to “Die Hard.”

description: GENEVA — Top minds at the world’s largest atom smasher have released a blueprint for a much bigger successor that could vastly improve research into the remaining enigmas of physics.
title: Scientists release plans for an even bigger atom smasher to address the mysteries of physics

description: Tennis icon Billie Jean King will be honored next week as the first female athlete with a Hollywood Walk of Fame star for Sports Entertainment.
title: Billie Jean King to receive Hollywood Walk of Fame star

description: WASHINGTON — A band of Republican lawmakers on Tuesday sunk an effort by Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., to kill a plan to allow remote voting for lawmakers who become new parents, a bitter dispute that brought the House floor to a halt.
title: GOP lawmakers sink Speaker Johnson's effort to kill remote voting push for new parents

description: Jean Smart can’t get enough Hannah Einbinder in her life.
title: How Hannah Einbinder reacted when 'Hacks' co-star Jean Smart got a new assistant who looks like her

description: Indiana University parted ways with a longtime athletic trainer after 44 seasons, the man's attorney said Tuesday.
title: Indiana University parts ways with athletic trainer accused of turning a blind eye to sexual abuse

description: NFL team owners had been set to vote Tuesday on Green Bay’s proposal to ban the play, but the proposal was tabled until May.
title: NFL owners postpone vote to ban 'tush push' play

description: WASHINGTON — At least five federal agencies are offering workers a new "deferred resignation" opportunity in the latest attempt by the Trump administration to slash the size of the U.S. government.
title: Several federal agencies launch a new 'deferred resignation' effort to encourage workers to leave their jobs

description: Detroit’s Isaiah Stewart was suspended for two games and four other players from the Pistons and Minnesota Timberwolves drew one-game suspensions for their roles in an on-court altercation between the teams earlier this week, the NBA said Tuesday.
title: Five NBA players suspended for fight between Pistons-Timberwolves that spilled into stands

description: The two NASA astronauts tell us how they handled the unexpected after a ten day test flight turned into a nine month stay in space.
title: Mission Space: Suni Williams & Butch Wilmore Back on Earth After an Epic Mission

description: California lawmakers will consider two bills aimed at keeping transgender kids and teens off sports teams consistent with their gender identity.
title: Battle over trans athletes' participation in girls' sports comes to California Capitol

description: Amid a flood of cheap imports, shrimpers in Alabama's Bayou La Batre are pleading with the Trump administration for steep tariffs.
title: Gulf Coast shrimpers say bring on Trump’s tariffs: ‘This industry is dying’

description: Attorney General Pam Bondi has directed prosecutors to seek the death penalty for Luigi Mangione, the man charged with killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
title: DOJ directs prosecutors to seek death penalty for Luigi Mangione

description: Attorney General Pamela Bondi on Tuesday directed federal prosecutors to seek the death penalty for Luigi Mangione, the man accused of gunning down UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in New York City last year.
title: Attorney General Pam Bondi directs federal prosecutors to seek death penalty for Luigi Mangione

description: A day after parts of the Midwest and the South were bombarded with severe thunderstorms, hail and tornadoes, another round of storms — and life-threatening flash flooding — has been forecast for the region.
title: Midwest and South brace for life-threatening flash flooding, hail and tornadoes

description: Sen. Cory Booker, D-N.J., has been speaking on the Senate floor for over 15 hours in an effort to protest President Trump and Elon Musk, saying he hopes to disrupt "normal business" by speaking for as long as possible.
title: Booker intends on 'disrupting normal business' of Senate in marathon floor speech

description: The "Meet the Press" moderator talks research, "gotcha questions" and navigating confrontational guests.
title: NBCU Academy: How Kristen Welker prepares for her biggest interviews

description: Three gunmen broke into former Seattle Seahawks cornerback Richard Sherman's house over the weekend while his wife and two children were home.
title: Video shows gunmen breaking into home of former Seahawks cornerback Richard Sherman

description: Some transgender people — along with their advocates and health care providers — fear the treatment of trans patients will worsen under President Donald Trump.
title: Transgender patients and their health providers fear worsening discrimination

description: New photos reveal the filthy and squalid conditions where a Connecticut man was allegedly held captive and starved by his stepmother for decades.
title: Photos reveal house of horrors where Connecticut man was allegedly held captive by stepmom

description: Philadelphia has its share of die-hard sports fans and, with a recent move, one young boy may have cemented his status among the most ardent fans.
title: 7-year-old boy gets Phillies-themed prosthetic arm

description: Calls from the U.S. to Roustan Hockey headquarters in Canada in recent weeks have been anything but routine, as bulk orders of name-brand sticks have suddenly become complicated conversations.
title: Trump tariff tumult has ripples for sporting goods, puts costly hockey gear in price-hike crosshair

description: Jury selection is set to get underway in Massachusetts for the second murder trial of Karen Read, who is accused of killing her boyfriend by running him over with her car. The first trial ended in a mistrial. NBC’s Stephanie Gosk reports for TODAY.
title: Karen Read jury selection set to begin for second trial

description: Layoffs began widely Tuesday morning at the Department of Health and Human Services as the agency sets out to cut some 10,000 full-time jobs as the Trump administration works to drastically shrink the size of the federal government.
title: Widespread job cuts begin at health agencies

description: Sen. Cory Booker delivered an overnight speech on the Senate floor to criticize the Trump administration's actions
title: Sen. Cory Booker holds hours-long overnight speech taking aim at the Trump administration

description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt holds a press briefing.
title: White House holds press briefing

description: Trump to sign new executive orders this afternoon
title: Europe has 'strong plan' to hit back against U.S. tariffs, E.U. chief warns

description: Elon Musk is going all in on a race to pick a new supreme court judge in Wisconsin, even offering two $1 million prizes to voters willing to sign a petition against “activist judges.” Meanwhile, there are to two races for Florida House seats that were vacated after appointments to President Donald Trump’s second administration. NBC’s Ryan Nobles reports for TODAY.
title: Inside the first special elections since Trump's return to office

description: President Donald Trump is expected to announce reciprocal tariffs on allies and adversaries worldwide, with the specifics under wraps until an announcement in the Rose Garden on Wednesday. The uncertainty is leaving businesses and buyers guessing at what the president has suggested will be a massive reordering of American trade. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Trump set to unveil reciprocal tariffs in Wednesday announcement

description: LAS VEGAS — Hollywood studio executives are making their case for theatergoing with a little help from John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr — along with the newly announced stars set to play them.
title: Who is playing your favorite Beatle? Star-studded biopic cast announced

description: Today’s elections in Wisconsin and Florida will serve as a referendum on Donald Trump and Elon Musk.
title: Two major elections and Karen Read murder case retrial: Morning Rundown

description: Karen Read, whose murder trial ended in a hung jury last year, returns to court this week as prosecutors try again to convict her in the 2022 killing of her boyfriend, John O' Keefe.
title: Karen Read murder case: Fired investigator Michael Proctor to loom over retrial as jury selection begins

description: The battleground state race will serve as a test of Democrats' strength in low-turnout, off-year contests.
title: Steve Kornacki: Two very different parts of Wisconsin that will tell the story of the state Supreme Court election

description: It's the latest meeting House GOP conference chair Lisa McClain has set up with members of Trump's Cabinet in an effort to keep lawmakers in the loop on White House plans.
title: Treasury secretary to meet with House Republicans as Trump eyes new tariffs

description: Get the latest on today's Wisconsin Supreme Court and other races, as well as Florida special elections. Find out how these races impact the Trump administration and what to watch for.
title: What to watch as Wisconsin and Florida host the first major elections of Trump's second term

description: HONOLULU — An unprecedented proposal from Maui’s mayor to phase out vacation rentals would alleviate a severe housing shortage aggravated by the 2023 wildfires but would also shrink the economy, University of Hawaii economists said in a report published Monday.
title: Maui mayor’s plan to phase out vacation rentals would increase housing but shrink the economy

description: Oscar-winning director Oliver Stone, whose 1991 film “JFK” portrayed President John F. Kennedy’s assassination as the work of a shadowy government conspiracy, is set to testify to Congress on Tuesday about thousands of newly released government documents surrounding the killing.
title: ‘JFK’ director Oliver Stone to testify to Congress about the newly released assassination files

description: A 7-year-old Nevada girl died after being struck by a falling boulder at a ski resort on Saturday, officials said.
title: 7-year-old killed by falling boulder at Nevada ski resort

description: Texas and Connecticut punched their tickets to the women's Final Four on Monday, joining UCLA and South Carolina.
title: UConn and Texas join UCLA and South Carolina in women's Final Four

description: Twenty workers at a Philadelphia-area charter school were charged in connection with the alleged abuse of young children and failure to report it, prosecutors announced Monday.
title: Staffers charged with abusing 26 children at Philadelphia-area school

description: A number of congressional Republicans are publicly voicing concern over the potential for a prolonged trade war and its effect on American farmers as President Donald Trump prepares to announce a new wave of tariffs.
title: Some Republicans ask for tariff exemptions and express concern over Trump trade war

description: President Donald Trump’s executive order seeking to overhaul the nation’s elections faced its first legal challenges Monday as the Democratic National Committee and a pair of nonprofits filed two separate lawsuits calling it unconstitutional.
title: Nonprofit groups and Democrats sue Trump administration over election executive order

description: Kenan Thompson is sharing his thoughts on Morgan Wallen’s abrupt exit after performing on “Saturday Night Live.”
title: Kenan Thompson on Morgan Wallen's abrupt 'SNL' exit: 'Seems like a complicated individual'

description: Miller Gardner, the 14-year-old son of former New York Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner who died in Costa Rica, is remembered as an active, kindhearted student who brought joy to family and friends.
title: Miller Gardner, son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner, remembered in heartfelt obituary

description: MINNEAPOLIS — A University of Minnesota graduate student who was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement was taken into custody because of a drunken driving infraction, not for being involved in protests, federal officials said Monday.
title: University of Minnesota student lost visa  for drunk driving, not protests, ICE says
